"Yes, I am Luther.
But who might you be, to address me so?"
"There aren't many who would know me by both face and name..."

"...Unless, of course, you are a spy...
working for Lutz."
"Brother! Surely you jest! This noble soul saved me when I was pursued by his men!"
"You lack foresight, Harriet. Did you never consider that this could be part of a greater scheme? Perhaps to follow us home, and find our hideout..."
"Brother!"
"I understand, I understand. Please calm down. The crown princess should not raise her voice like that."
"The same goes to you, my older brother."
"My claim to the throne is long passed. I no longer have an underlying royal duty to bind my thoughts, actions, or the subjects of my research."
"I see! This must be what Alma was talking about!"
"It's like the records of what has been have all been messed up. Since this is basically a dream, anything within the bounds of possibility can become a reality!"
"But... Luther, of all people, as Harriet's brother? This exceeds all rational notions of plausibility..."

"Hey! Watch out!
What're you doing?!"

"Hmm... a fairy?
Just as the legends describe it..."
"Then you must be... a savior from another world. Just as has been foretold."
"Y-you know that we're from another world?!"
"I am one of this world's foremost magical researchers. I can tell simply by examining the flow of your Mana. It is clearly different from that which the humans of this world possess."
"Besides which, this is a world of Summoners. And it is I who invented summoning in the first place."
"I would never have begun such research without believing in the existence of other worlds, now would I?"
"That aside, I have questions about you. That form should permit neither flight nor the ability to understand human speech."
"Our legends attribute such gifts to you, but I'm fascinated to learn how they work. Would it trouble you to become the subject of my research?"
"Even in an alternate universe, he's the same as ever!"

"Hey! Listen!
Please, help meee!"
"1. Perhaps another time."
"2. Please don't tease her."

"Hmm... very well.
Now, for our primary concern..."

"Oh, I'm quite serious...
Ah, but my dear sister's bitter gaze speaks of her distaste for this subject. Very well then, we shall proceed with our more pressing concern."
"Allow me to explain the current state of affairs within our country, and what has led us to this civil war."
